nodes.label: White Blood Cells
nodes.description: Cells of the immune system involved in protecting the body against infectious disease and foreign invaders.

nodes.label: RBC
nodes.description: Red Blood Cells carry oxygen from the lungs to the rest of the body.

nodes.label: Hemoglobin
nodes.description: A protein in red blood cells that carries oxygen to organs and tissues.

nodes.label: Hematocrit
nodes.description: The proportion of red blood cells in your blood.

nodes.label: MCV
nodes.description: Mean Corpuscular Volume measures the average size of red blood cells.

nodes.label: Platelets
nodes.description: Small blood cells that help your body form clots to stop bleeding.

nodes.label: Neutrophils %
nodes.description: Percentage of neutrophils, the most common white blood cell type.

nodes.label: Lymphocytes %
nodes.description: Percentage of lymphocytes (T-cells, B-cells), crucial for immune response.

nodes.label: Absolute Neutrophils
nodes.description: Absolute number of neutrophils per microliter of blood.

nodes.label: Glucose (Fasting)
nodes.description: Blood sugar level, the body's primary source of energy.

nodes.label: Hemoglobin A1C
nodes.description: Average blood sugar level over the past 2-3 months.

nodes.label: Insulin (Fasting)
nodes.description: Hormone that regulates blood sugar; elevated levels indicate insulin resistance.

nodes.label: HOMA-IR
nodes.description: Homeostatic Model Assessment for Insulin Resistance.

nodes.label: BUN
nodes.description: Blood Urea Nitrogen, a waste product indicating kidney function.

nodes.label: Creatinine
nodes.description: A chemical waste product used to assess kidney function.

nodes.label: eGFR
nodes.description: Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate, the best test of kidney function.

nodes.label: Uric Acid
nodes.description: A waste product from purine breakdown; high levels cause gout.

nodes.label: Sodium
nodes.description: Essential electrolyte that helps maintain fluid balance.

nodes.label: Potassium
nodes.description: An essential mineral that helps nerves and muscles communicate.

nodes.label: Calcium
nodes.description: A mineral vital for healthy bones, teeth, muscle, and nerve function.

nodes.label: Magnesium
nodes.description: Important for muscle/nerve function, blood glucose control, and blood pressure.

nodes.label: Phosphorus
nodes.description: Works with calcium to build strong bones and teeth.

nodes.label: Iron (Serum)
nodes.description: Essential mineral for hemoglobin production and oxygen transport.

nodes.label: Zinc
nodes.description: Essential for immune function, wound healing, and DNA synthesis.

nodes.label: ALT (SGPT)
nodes.description: Alanine Aminotransferase, an enzyme found mainly in the liver.

nodes.label: AST (SGOT)
nodes.description: Aspartate Aminotransferase, found in the liver and muscles.

nodes.label: Alkaline Phosphatase
nodes.description: An enzyme related to bile ducts; increased when blocked.

nodes.label: Bilirubin Total
nodes.description: A yellowish pigment found in bile, produced by the liver.

nodes.label: GGT
nodes.description: Gamma-Glutamyl Transferase, elevated in liver/bile duct disease.

nodes.label: Albumin
nodes.description: A protein made by the liver; indicates nutritional status.

nodes.label: Total Cholesterol
nodes.description: Total amount of cholesterol in the blood.

nodes.label: LDL Cholesterol
nodes.description: Low-Density Lipoprotein, often called 'bad' cholesterol.

nodes.label: HDL Cholesterol
nodes.description: High-Density Lipoprotein, often called 'good' cholesterol.

nodes.label: Triglycerides
nodes.description: A type of fat (lipid) found in your blood.

nodes.label: VLDL
nodes.description: Very Low-Density Lipoprotein, carries triglycerides.

nodes.label: Lp(a)
nodes.description: Lipoprotein(a), a genetic risk factor for cardiovascular disease.

nodes.label: ApoB
nodes.description: Apolipoprotein B, the primary protein in LDL particles.

nodes.label: CRP (hs-CRP)
nodes.description: High-sensitivity C-Reactive Protein, a key marker of systemic inflammation.

nodes.label: ESR
nodes.description: Erythrocyte Sedimentation Rate, a non-specific marker of inflammation.

nodes.label: IL-6
nodes.description: Interleukin-6, a pro-inflammatory cytokine.

nodes.label: TNF-alpha
nodes.description: Tumor Necrosis Factor alpha, a pro-inflammatory cytokine.

nodes.label: Homocysteine
nodes.description: An amino acid; high levels linked to heart disease and inflammation.

nodes.label: Blood Pressure (Systolic)
nodes.description: The pressure when your heart beats (top number).

nodes.label: Blood Pressure (Diastolic)
nodes.description: The pressure between heartbeats (bottom number).

nodes.label: Omega-3 Index
nodes.description: Percentage of EPA+DHA in red blood cell membranes.

nodes.label: Fibrinogen
nodes.description: A protein essential for blood clot formation.

nodes.label: TSH
nodes.description: Thyroid Stimulating Hormone, controls thyroid gland activity.

nodes.label: Free T4
nodes.description: Free thyroxine, the active form of thyroid hormone.

nodes.label: Free T3
nodes.description: Free triiodothyronine, the most active thyroid hormone.

nodes.label: Vitamin D (25-OH)
nodes.description: Indicator of Vitamin D stores; crucial for bone and immune health.

nodes.label: Vitamin B12
nodes.description: Essential for nerve tissue health, brain function, and red blood cells.

nodes.label: Folate
nodes.description: Vital for making red blood cells and for DNA synthesis.

nodes.label: Vitamin A (Retinol)
nodes.description: Essential for vision, immune function, and skin health.

nodes.label: Vitamin C
nodes.description: Powerful antioxidant important for immune function and collagen synthesis.

nodes.label: Vitamin E
nodes.description: Fat-soluble antioxidant protecting cells from oxidative damage.

nodes.label: Vitamin K
nodes.description: Essential for blood clotting and bone metabolism.

nodes.label: Cortisol
nodes.description: The primary stress hormone produced by the adrenal glands.

nodes.label: Testosterone
nodes.description: Primary male sex hormone, also important in females.

nodes.label: Estradiol
nodes.description: The strongest form of estrogen, important for reproductive health.

nodes.label: DHEA-S
nodes.description: A hormone produced by the adrenal glands, a precursor to sex hormones.

nodes.label: Ferritin
nodes.description: A blood protein that stores iron; best indicator of iron stores.

nodes.label: TIBC
nodes.description: Total Iron-Binding Capacity, measures transferrin availability.

nodes.label: Total Protein
nodes.description: Total albumin and globulin in blood.

nodes.label: Globulin
nodes.description: Proteins made by the liver and immune system.

nodes.label: Anchovies
nodes.description: Small oily fish rich in EPA and DHA.

nodes.label: Trout
nodes.description: Fatty fish with omega-3 fatty acids and vitamin D.

nodes.label: Tuna
nodes.description: Lean seafood source of protein and omega-3 fats.

nodes.label: Cabbage
nodes.description: Cruciferous vegetable rich in vitamin C and polyphenols.

nodes.label: Cauliflower
nodes.description: Cruciferous vegetable with antioxidant compounds.

nodes.label: Arugula
nodes.description: Leafy green naturally rich in nitrates and vitamin K.

nodes.label: Pistachios
nodes.description: Nut rich in fiber, phytosterols, and unsaturated fats.

nodes.label: Cashews
nodes.description: Nut containing magnesium and unsaturated fats.

nodes.label: Black Tea
nodes.description: Tea rich in theaflavins and polyphenols.

nodes.label: Buckwheat
nodes.description: Whole-grain pseudocereal with fiber and rutin.

nodes.label: Olives
nodes.description: Whole-food source of monounsaturated fats and polyphenols.

nodes.label: Chamomile Tea
nodes.description: Herbal tea traditionally used for stress support.
